caption: Beautiful place, you feel that you are in NYC in the USA,when you see the statues. It‚Äôs free to visit. Also you can see the Eiffel Tower completely from there, plus they have free sport‚Äôs machines behind the statue if you like to workout . I recommend you to visit it.

The Statue of Liberty in Paris is a must-visit gem! Though smaller than its iconic counterpart in New York, this replica holds immense charm and historical significance. Located on √éle aux Cygnes, it offers stunning views of the Seine and an atmosphere of tranquility. The detail and craftsmanship are remarkable, and the connection between France and the United States is beautifully symbolized. Perfect for a quiet stroll and a great spot for photos, this landmark is both inspiring and uniquely Parisian. Highly recommended for history buffs and those seeking hidden treasures in the city!

The Statue of Liberty in Paris is a charming, lesser-known replica of the famous New York landmark. Located on the √éle aux Cygnes, it's a peaceful spot offering great views of the Seine and the Eiffel Tower. While smaller than its counterpart, it‚Äôs a lovely sight to see and adds a unique touch to a Parisian visit. Perfect for a quiet walk or a photo opportunity. Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area!

We visited the Statue of Liberty in Paris in the evening. Although we didn‚Äôt go up close to the monument, the view from afar was stunning. The statue looks beautiful at night, illuminated against the skyline. You can also enjoy a great view of the Eiffel Tower from this spot, which adds to the charm of the location. It‚Äôs a perfect place for an evening stroll with a scenic backdrop!

This Statue of Liberty Paris is located on what is called swan Island; accessible on foot by walking on one of the bridges that crosses the Siene River (Pont De Grenelle). When you go under this bridge (via the stairs) towards the statue, you will also walkthrough an outdoor workout gym that was constructed underneath the bridge.

I recently visited the Statue of Liberty in Paris, and it was a delightful experience! This smaller version of the iconic New York statue that is located on the √éle aux Cygnes in the Seine River. The setting is beautiful, offering picturesque views of the river and the surrounding cityscape. It's a peaceful spot perfect for a leisurely stroll or a moment of reflection. The statue itself is impressive and a wonderful symbol of the friendship between France and the United States. Overall, it's a must-visit landmark that adds a unique charm to the Parisian experience.

Get a Lime bicycle ride unlimited for the month, that is the most economical way to visit Paris and you go through scenics views only riders can see‚Ä¶ for the Statue of Liberty ride all along next to the Siena for miles and you will see the Statue of Liberty with a Eiffel tower in the background, 2 iconic landmarks in one shoot.

The Statue of Liberty in Paris, located on the √éle aux Cygnes in the Seine River, is a smaller replica of the iconic American monument. Gifted by the American community in Paris to commemorate the centennial of the French Revolution, this statue stands at about 11.5 meters tall. It faces westward, symbolically looking towards its larger counterpart in New York. The statue's location offers a picturesque view, and its significance highlights the enduring friendship between France and the United States. It's a charming and historically rich landmark that adds a unique touch to the Parisian landscape.
Cute to go and see the mini lady of liberty. While you can walk down to the bottom I just enjoyed the views from the top

A truly impressive sight We recommend visiting it.

Located in the middle of the Seine, on an island accessible only by a "really long" walk.  Unfortunately, the car park is not nearby.  The long walk leading to the Statue of Liberty in Paris is between the pleasant and the dangerous at times.  The walk is mandatory as the place is inaccessible from other parts.  The statue is impressive and well maintained.  Just behind the statue there is a kids' meeting place, a park under the bridge with various sports equipment.

It is quite remarkable to see the Statue of Liberty in Paris. I have not been to NYC yet so this is my first time. What I think is really cool is the fact that the Eiffel Tower is just behind, defeating distances and perceptions. Both monuments meters apart. Really impressive sight

Fascinating to find out that there is a quarter-scale replica of The Statue of Liberty in Paris. After all, the statue in New York was a gift to the USA from France.  If you‚Äôre in the neighbourhood, go see it, but don‚Äôt go out of your way.

Smaller version of statue of Liberty in US. Had to walk 30 minutes from champ de mars park, next to Eifel tower to reach there. Beautiful statue but its hard to take a good picture as its very vlose to the river and also because its facing the river.

Visiting the Statue of Liberty in Paris was a charming and unexpected experience! While not as grand as its iconic counterpart in New York City, this smaller replica has its own unique allure and symbolism.  The statue, a gift from the United States to France, is a symbol of friendship and cooperation between the two nations. Its location on the √éle aux Cygnes, a peaceful island in the Seine River, adds to its tranquility.  Though smaller in size, the Statue of Liberty Paris still carries the essence of freedom and democracy. It's a lovely sight to behold, especially during sunset when the golden hues illuminate the statue and the surrounding area.  The spot offers a picturesque view of the Seine River and the nearby Eiffel Tower, making it a great spot for capturing memorable photos.  Keep in mind that the Statue of Liberty Paris is not a large tourist attraction, so you can enjoy a quieter visit compared to some of the more bustling landmarks in the city.  If you're in Paris and have a fondness for symbolism and history, this miniature Statue of Liberty is a charming addition to your itinerary. It's a perfect spot to reflect on the enduring relationship between France and the United States and the ideals of liberty and friendship it represents.
Nice observation area on the lower half or great view from the bridge. If you want a better view of both the statue and tower in the background you‚Äôll have to move further back down the street.
There are several Statues of Liberty in PARIS... this one is stunning !

One of the lesser-known sights in Paris, but still worth a visit. Much smaller than in New York but no less worth seeing. Can be combined with a walk from the Eiffel Tower. There is even a very small Statue of Liberty in the Jardin du Luxembourg.
A miniature version of the statue, lovely walk along the Il√© de Cygnes to the statue. Would also recommend possibly doing this by one of the tourist boats and would get an even better view

The grandest replica of all is just off the Grenelle Bridge on the little man-made island called √éle aux Cygnes. While Liberty in New York was a gift from the French, this statue in Paris was a gift from the Americans. And it‚Äôs the biggest too (there are 6 statues in Paris) at 11.50 metres (37 feet 9 inches).

France gave the U.S. the Statue of Liberty in 1886; Americans gave Paris a smaller version of the same statue in 1889. There are many magnificent sites one can expect to see from the top of the Eiffel Tower: the Arc de Triomphe; Notre-Dame Cathedral; the Louvre. Something one might not expect to see is a replica of the Statue of Liberty. And yet, just to the south, smack dab in the middle of the river Seine, by golly there it is.  The quarter-scale replica sits on the southern end of √éle aux Cygnes, an artificial island built in the Seine in 1827 to separate river traffic from the busy port of Grenelle. Over time, a tree-lined walkway¬†was built that runs the full 850-meter length of the island, and three bridges were built across the island to connect the 15th and 16th arrondissements.¬†√éle aux Cygnes is the third-largest island in Paris. The statue itself was given to the city of Paris in 1889 by the American community in Paris to commemorate the centennial of the French Revolution.¬†In characteristic American fashion, the statue was officially inaugurated¬†on the Fourth of July (a date not at all associated with the French Revolution) rather than Bastille Day (a mere ten days later, and often described to the uninitiated as the¬†‚ÄúFrench Fourth of July‚Äù). To be fair, the inauguration was presided over by French President Marie Fran¬≠√ßois Sadi Carnot, who probably had other things to do on Bastille Day (also, the statue‚Äôs tablet bears the date July 14, 1789, as well as July 4, 1776). The gift was given to highlight the historically close bond between France and the United States, and reaffirm the dedication of the two nations to the republican ideal on which they were founded. This Pont de Grenelle Statue of Liberty¬†was installed some three years after the New York Statue of Liberty, and in fact was originally one of the working models made whilst preparing to construct¬†the ‚Äúreal thing.‚Äù The statue can be accessed via either the Pont de Grenelle or the Pont de Bir-Hakeim, both of which cross the¬†√éle aux Cygnes. While this is not the only Statue of Liberty replica in Paris‚Äîboth the Mus√©e d‚ÄôOrsay and the Mus√©e des Arts et M√©tiers house their own‚Äîthis¬†is¬†the only Statue of Liberty replica in Paris that was featured in¬†National Treasure: Book of Secrets. That alone is worth the cost of admission

An interestning place to take some photos and selfies because it is similar to that one in the US. The view from the bridge can be also nice with the sun in the sky but when you reach down the statue you can see its face. The distance from eifel tower is not too much and by foot would be like 40 min. So it would be a nice journey after visiting the tower!
